result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teion Tyrontae Gordon

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-21-22

Defendant Teion Tyrontae Gordon in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Teion Tyrontae Gordon.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Cerniglia is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Teion Tyrontae Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Teion Tyrontae Gordon.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court reinstated the signature bond. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 9-27-2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until 10-03-2022 at 8:30 am for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 40.  Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

10:29 AM Defendant Teion Tyrontae Gordon not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 9-26-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Teion Tyrontae Gordon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared by video for Teion Tyrontae Gordon.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Teion Tyrontae Gordon
Current: 2562 N 51st St, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 09-06-2022)
Prior: 2411 North 57th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Teion Tyrontae Gordon not in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/31/22 @ 2p
